name: Suite Novotel Berlin Potsdamer Platz

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel 4 days when visiting Berlin. The location is very good, close to the subway, one block away from Potsdamer Platz and a short walk from important venues and historical landmarks.The hotel area has sufficient bars and restaurants and is safe, even at night.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the reception was very friendly and helpfull. The rooms are modern with clever design and the facilities are enhanced with a microwave, coffee/tea/, waterboiler and an excellent bathroom. The room itselve was kept perfectly clean every day. Plenty of room for two or even three people.
reviews.title: Where East met West

reviews.text: Only negative point was the restaurant in the adjecent Ibis hotel that is shared with this hotel. The food I got was so horrible, I couldn't even stand having the plate in front of me (since when is bolognese sauce made with liver?). Noticing my unhappiness with the stench, the staff avoided eyecontact and ignored me, so I was forced to get up to the bar, pay and go look for real food elsewhere.
reviews.title: Turn down the hallway lights

likes.liked: — Internet not available on my floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the SuiteHotel in Berlin. This is part of the Accor chain and the Etap and Ibis were adjacent. Conviently situated for Anhalter Bahnhof underground this is certainly not on Potsdamer Platz, as the details suggested and is not the best area in the city. The surrounding area is a bit run down.
reviews.title: Great hotel/ hard bed

reviews.text: The room was large and would sleep an extra 2 people on a rollaway and the sofa for an additional charge. The bathroom had bath and a separate shower and as in most Accor hotels the loo was separate. I booked this hotel thinking it had some cooking facilities which allows us extra flexibility; while it had a useful fridge, a kettle and a microwave it certainly is not for self caterers as there was no other eqipment-impossible to do even breakfast with a McDonalds style coffee cup and spatula which came with the 2 sachets of coffee and 2 tea bags left each day. I need to do my research better!
reviews.title: Great room, would go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here beginning of Nov, superb. Was in an excellent position only 5 min walk from potsdamer platz, 5 mins from checkpoint charlie, 15 mins from bradenburg gate and reichstag.
reviews.title: Fab hotel amazing staff great location

reviews.text: Rooms are modern but really spacious with lovely bathroom and super comfartable bed. Staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Suite idea - give it a go!

likes.liked: — Nice concept and design of the room; great location
likes.disliked: — Breakfast too expensive (and not that great, either)

reviews.text: We are going back, if you want a reasonably priced hotel in Berlin then this is perfect.
reviews.title: Functional with a great location

likes.disliked: — No frills...but you get what you pay for!

reviews.text: OK, so it's a bland chain hotel, but at least it's a bland chain hotel
reviews.title: Decent Hotel what did the job

likes.disliked: — Not enough PC's for internet in Lobby

reviews.text: with a difference. I really like the "suite" concept; when you're away
reviews.title: Like having a Whopper meal

reviews.text: This is a modern chain hotel, but the size and quality of the rooms is well above the average. There is an underground car park below the hotel (which is very useful in Berlin!).
reviews.title: Brilliant!

likes.liked: — Quality of the huge rooms and central location

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights, and the central location made it easy to get around all the major sights. Highly recommended is the Cafe Stressemann just round the corner - sort of old fashioned with great food and ambience - and not expensive!
reviews.title: Great Choice, Great Location

reviews.text: Breakfast in the hotel is a little unusual. It's a help yourself affair in a lounge area and everything comes in little plastic containers kept in chill cabinets. Sometimes you weren't quite sure what it was in the little plastic cups.....
reviews.title: Comfortable and stylish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a superb hotel to stay in when visiting a very interesting city.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of Potsdamer Platz, Checkpoint Charlie Museum, Unter den Linden sights, etc. Our room was very spacious, especially by European standards. There were three of us and the bed arrangement (king plus another twin) was perfect. We liked having the toilet and small sink completely separated from the larger bathroom with tub, shower stall and sink. Everything was spotlessly clean. We didn't bother with the breakfast, but there was free coffee along with croissants or rolls in the lobby. The restaurant directly across the street has a good breakfast for less than 5 euros. Computers in the lobby are a nice touch. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you need to fit more than two people in a room.
reviews.title: Great place to spend a few nights in!

likes.liked: — The clean room and bathroom. Also, the free internet station at the reception area!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We reserved 2 rooms under the special rate, which meant that we could not amend or cancel our booking and we had to pay upfront by credit card. This we thought was fine as we saw no reason to cancel. However, one of the travellers with us missed his flight and so we only needed one room.
reviews.title: Nice place..

reviews.text: Upon check in I explained this (11pm by the way) to the man who saw to us. He tried to book us in, but had problems - I think he was new. So a more senior worker came to assist. Firstly she told us that we had not paid, only reserved the rooms with my card and then tried to have a go at me for not cancelling the second room earlier so she could have sold it on. However, one minute later she discovered that we had actually paid for the room and whether we had one or two rooms was neither here nor there as they were both paid for. She was not the most friendliest of people and her customer service skills leave alot to be desired!
reviews.title: Overall stay was Okay!

reviews.text: However, on a more positive note we really loved our room, it was spacious, nicely decorated and had everything (plus more) for a weekend break.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We never saw that lady again, and all the staff afterwards were helpful and friendly (especially when I got blisters from walking for 14 hours!!)
reviews.title: Would def stay there again!

reviews.text: We never ate the breakfast at the hotel after reading about and then seeing the odd way it was served. We ate at the Stresemann cafe across the road, which was much cheaper and lovely!
reviews.title: Great choice! nice quality/price ratio and excellent location!

likes.liked: — The room size, the location, the price, the room design and the good service...
likes.disliked: — No wifi in the rooms... altought they have free internet on the lobby...

aka: Suite Novotel Berlin Potsdamer Platz Hotel Berlin
description: 3 star hotel in the historic centre of Berlin, a short walk from Potsdamer Platz,Checkpoint Charlie and the Brandenburg Gate.13 km from Tegel airport.229 inviting modular suites with airconditioning, 30sqm in size.Friendly atmosphere. 24 hour services include Boutique Gourmande gourmet food counter, gym, WiFi, business corner with WiFi access and free high speed Internet. Bar, complimentary massage on Thursday evenings, private undercover car park. Accessible for persons with limited mobility.
